title: WATCH: F1 2017 v 2016
text:
F1 2016 v F1 2017: Lewis Hamilton's Australian GP poles compared Last Updated: 25/03/17 9:41am Paul Di Resta is at the SkyPad to look at the difference between Lewis Hamilton's Australian pole laps in 2016 and 2017. So how much faster is Formula 1 in 2017 compared to 2016? 
Well, watch for yourself as Lewis Hamilton's Australian GP pole position laps from this year and last are given the SkyPad treatment after the new season's opening qualifying session. 
F1's new-for-2017 cars have been designed to be the fastest ever seen in the sport and Albert Park's outright lap record was broken four times during Saturday's running. 
After claiming pole in 2016 with a lap of 1:23.837, Hamilton went 1.7 seconds faster in the new Mercedes W08 - so watch above as Paul Di Resta analyses where the 2017 car made the difference.
